channel.title: Freshly Made Sketches on Nancy's Creative Mess
channel.description: Recent content in Freshly Made Sketches on Nancy's Creative Mess

item.title: *Freshly Made Sketches #552*
item.description: I got home from work yesterday and sat down in my creative space, hoping to make a card. I saw the latest sketch at Freshly Made Sketches and decided to try my hand at it… I really hope my mojo shows up on the rest of my days off this week… Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black *Paper: MFT Party Time *Images: Pink Fresh Studios Happy Birthday Sentiments *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne

item.title: *Color Throwdown #706*
item.description: I had to play along with the latest challenge at Color Throwdown because I really love the look of blue and green together. I usually choose the brighter forms of these colours to go together but I strayed from that with this card to use up a scrap of very old patterned paper I had in my stash. Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Marina Mist *Paper: My Mind’s Eye *Images: Spellbinders Sentiments for Your

item.title: *Freshly Made Sketches #549*
item.description: I found a little time before work yesterday to play along with the current challenge at Freshly Made Sketches. I was able to use a piece I did with my Glimmer Hot Foil machine…. used the solid foiling plate to use the left over foil from another project. Card Info *Cardstock: Hammermill Premium Color Copy; Stampin’ Up! Basic Black *Images: Taylored Expressions Simple Strips *Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne *Dies: Taylored Expressions Simple Strips; Scrapbook.

item.title: *Freshly Made Sketches #543*
item.description: I loved the sketch the Cecile had for Freshly Made Sketches this week… I’m glad I had a few minutes at my craft table to play along! My card originally much more plain as I stamped directly on the larger white square and put the card together. The more I looked at it the more I knew it needed a little something more. I cut a smaller square and stamped on it then used my Perfect Layers tool to create a green border and then put it on top of what I had originally created… and it looks SO much better in my opinion!

item.title: *Freshly Made Sketches #342*
item.description: I loved the ease of the sketch by Kim at Freshly Made Sketches this week. I combined the idea of using patterned paper with Kim’s idea of horizontal stripes to create my card. I also used a stamp and die that I bought YEARS ago that I’ve never used! Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Basic Black, Granny Apple Green *Paper: Stampin’ Up! Pattern Party *Images: Scrapbook & Cards Today; MFT Bitty Birthday Greetings

item.title: *Freshly Made #538*
item.description: I was able to get myself caught up with design team duties and found a little time to play with some current challenges. Today I’m sharing the card I created for the latest sketch at Freshly Made Sketches. I was able to grab this flower from my bin of extras to add a pop of colour to my black and white card. Card Info *Paper: MFT Black & White Stripes

item.title: *Wish Big*
item.description: Well *you* can’t see that this card says “wish big”, but it does. I used black ink on the blue cardstock and it’s really subtle but it’s there. I should have done something different, but honestly, the card was all put together when I decided to stamp on the strip. It was a bad decision LOL! Card Info *Cardstock: Stampin’ Up! Berry Burst, Lemon Lime Twist, Starry Sky *Images: MFT Bitty Birthday Greetings
